availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hughey J. Limbrake (Grant County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of William Limbrake and Louisa Limbrake. Married to Martha Odor Limbrake in Pendleton County, Kentucky, on July 4, 1863. Father of Emma J. Limbrake. Farmer in Grant County in 1860. Attended school in Grant County in 1860. Enlisted in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private on August 1, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 849.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Cordova, p. 494B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0109.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pendleton County Marriages, Film 000272800, p. 227.
KYR-0002-227-0008.
